alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Faribault; McLeod; Nicollet; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 5:58PM CST until February 23 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW TAPERS OFF AND HAZARDOUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING... .Snow continues to exit the region, and another round of Arctic air will settle in behind the storm system overnight. Wind chills of 25 to 35 below zero are forecast tonight as the cold air moves in. The best chance for the colder part of this range will be over western Minnesota where the winds will remain higher. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Sibley, McLeod, Blue Earth, Nicollet and Faribault Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Blue Earth; Faribault; McLeod; Nicollet; Sibley
